channel.title: 1.7 Pistons
channel.description:
http://www.youtube.com/embed/uZJr86d2IUo
Oh man. I nearly crapped myself at 2:42
im envisioning a room with 2 switches on the floor. press the right one and the wall opens up to the next room. press the wrong one and lava comes down from the celing

item.title: 1.7 Pistons
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:44, topic:399377”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=496512.msg3655659#msg3655659 date=1309993510]

The thing is crafting tables are easy to break and you cant store stuff in them like you can a dispenser, chest, or furnace, so being able to move them isnt really any different than moving a normal block.
[/quote]I thought the reason for not being able to move them is that the associated metadata can’t be stored because the block itself is metadata of the piston. So yeah, it doesn’t really make sense that crafting benches can be moved.

Im not quite sure tbh, nor am i positive that my comment is accurate, its just a theory[/quote]Actually I didn’t read your post properly. What you said was correct, because crafting benches don’t actually store anything.

[quote="“http://www.minecraftwiki.net/wiki/Piston”"]Some blocks cannot be pushed by Pistons and the piston head will not extend:

  • Obsidian, Bedrock to avoid abuse
  • Blocks with extra data (tile entities) attached - note block, chest, furnace, dispenser, monster spawner.
  • Extended pistons (both sticky and normal) because moving blocks are temporarily stored as tile entities.
    Portals[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: 1.7 Pistons
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:43, topic:399377”][quote author=badger41 link=topic=496512.msg3655400#msg3655400 date=1309981207]
The thing is crafting tables are easy to break and you cant store stuff in them like you can a dispenser, chest, or furnace, so being able to move them isnt really any different than moving a normal block.
[/quote]I thought the reason for not being able to move them is that the associated metadata can’t be stored because the block itself is metadata of the piston. So yeah, it doesn’t really make sense that crafting benches can be moved.[/quote]

Im not quite sure tbh, nor am i positive that my comment is accurate, its just a theory

Read full topic

item.title: 1.7 Pistons
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:

[quote=“badger41, post:42, topic:399377”]The thing is crafting tables are easy to break and you cant store stuff in them like you can a dispenser, chest, or furnace, so being able to move them isnt really any different than moving a normal block.[/quote]I thought the reason for not being able to move them is that the associated metadata can’t be stored because the block itself is metadata of the piston. So yeah, it doesn’t really make sense that crafting benches can be moved.

item.title: 1.7 Pistons
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

B2300 T4nk:

Pistons cant push stuff a player can open EG: Chests, crafting benches, and furnaces.

Oh ok.
I’ve seen some nice traps in my time.
Simplest one would be have pressure plates wired to a door and some pistons, have a delay, with pistons already turned on, when it goes off have them drop sand/gravel on you. However, make sure the roof (or the next open area available for a player to stand) has lava/cacti as the flooring, for if they attempt to log out, they will spawn in the next open area. If that area is lava or cacti, obviously they die.

Read full topic

item.title: 1.7 Pistons
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:34, topic:399377”][quote author=mironic link=topic=496512.msg3653697#msg3653697 date=1309892542]

[quote author=whattehp406 link=topic=496512.msg3653646#msg3653646 date=1309890694]

Corridor, walk on pressure plate, surround them in obsidian, drop lava on them.
[/quote]Too bad pistons can’t move obsidian
[/quote] they can move diamond blocks though.

do cobble strairs, hardest block to break thats still moveable[/quote]
I think furnaces are harder, and definately worth it in the long run. Although I’m not sure if pistons can push them…?

Read full topic

item.title: 1.7 Pistons
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“mironic, post:29, topic:399377”][quote author=Tom_BETA link=topic=496512.msg3653604#msg3653604 date=1309889450]

You can crush people with these right?
[/quote]No, you can only suffocate from above and apparently that’s a bug.

That’s bad, what other good uses is there? I’m not interested in making a happy village I want methods of killing people.

Notch, notch…

you can still close lots of stuff on them… and controll lava… crush them with cobblestone.[/quote]

That’s what I meant, put a sticky one with a block and suffocate them. But I guess I could also create a never ending pit, and setup sand houses on it for people. When it reaches 5 people the floor disappears and the innocent people and the sand houses go down to bedrock.

Where I have a room to collect there items. I’m starting to like this piston update…

Read full topic

item.title: 1.7 Pistons
item.dc:creator: @B2300_T4nk B2300 T4nk
item.description:
@B2300_T4nk wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:22, topic:399377”][quote author=B2300 T4nk link=topic=496512.msg3650542#msg3650542 date=1309708020]

Does anyone know if we’ll be able to move pistons with pistons?

You can move them sideways, notice in the video that secret door, first the blocks move in, and then out, and when he examined i saw that first the piston is pushed into the hallway, and then that piston is activated which pushes the block out to seal the doorway.

I really hope they can be stacked though, would make for a good elevator!
[/quote]Tried, didn’t work.

Ive managed to replicated the secret doorway accurately to what was in the sneak video, and its easy to do once you figure out the many ways pistons can be activated[/quote]Talking about the elevator yo.

Read full topic
